poem:
### Hesitation

Tomahawks in the air  
linger, like words withheld—  
hope's fragile grip,  
the weight of waiting,  
a delicate balance.  
Promises float,  
unspoken, restless  
between breaths—  
arms folded across oceans,  
whispering  
against the echo  
of distant shores,  
wondering  
when silence  
will become  
a gift of peace.
